Case reference: 2014005195.CaseDesc: Tommy Charpentier worked on a farm and lived with his employer in Sainte-Brigitte-des-Saults. On the night of December 15, 2008, tracks in the snow indicate that he may have walked on the Nicolet River that passes in front of the farm. Mr. Charpentier’s clothes were found on the frozen surface of the river, near an opening in the ice. This suggests that Mr. Charpentier may have jumped into the icy waters of the Nicolet River.

Scar: Ears, Right ear piercing without earring.
Chest, Left nipple piercing without a ring

Case reference: 2014003946.CaseDesc: Jean Siegel went missing from her home on May 31, 1962. Ms. Siegel had left her home on three previous occasions but always returned on her own. Jean Siegel's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014001016.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1983, the body of an unidentified man was found floating on the St-Lawrence river between L’ile Bouchard et St-Sulpice in Quebec. The man wore a partial upper denture and was missing three teeth.

Case reference: 2014005052.CaseDesc: On March 28, 2007, Ohanes Melkon was last seen when he departed his residence located in Innisfail, Alberta to go purchase food.

Case reference: 2014003814.CaseDesc: On April 27, 1980, Leon Kitchekesik and his parents were staying at their cabin on Gull Lake. Leon was walking along the shore with his three year old sister. The parents went to investigate when they heard the screams of their daughter. The parents located footprints approaching a small hole and none leading away from the hole. There was a land search conducted however it is felt the boy drowned.

Case reference: 2014003729.CaseDesc: On April 6, 1997, Céline Mercier was seen for the last time at her home in Levis, Quebec. Her vehicle was recovered near the Pierre-Laporte Bridge, which spans the cities of Levis and Quebec. Céline hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006010299.CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.

Case reference: 2010002299.CaseDesc: Susan Gourley was last seen in late November of 2001, by a friend, in the area of Barton Street and Stirton Avenue, in downtown Hamilton.  She was reported missing by her mother February 28th, 2002.

Case reference: 2013000024.CaseDesc: Susan Dawson was living with, and working for, Terry Murphy for approximately 3 weeks prior to her disappearance. She was last seen in the late hours of November 12, 1985 at a gathering at Terry's house. On November 13, a blue car was seen in Terry's yard. On November 14, at approximately 11:55 a.m., a massive explosion occurred at Terry's residence. Terry's remains were found in the debris but there was no indication that Susan was in the house at the time of the explosion. Investigators suspect foul play, and that Terry had some involvement with Susan's disappearance.

Case reference: 2012020096.CaseDesc: On September 17, 2008, Kevin Michel was with two other people at Usinne Lake, near Creighton, Saskatchewan, harvesting rice. Witnesses state Kevin walked away from their camp for reasons unknown. Extensive ground, air and water searches were conducted in the area but failed to locate Kevin.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, "Kevin heart bombers" (text) or "Kevin (heart symbol) bombers"

Case reference: 2014001178.CaseDesc: The body of this adult male was found floating in the Fraser River near Prince George, British Columbia, on July 10, 1967. He wore upper dentures and it is believed he was in the water seven to ten days.

Pants: Blue, Suit Style, Dress pants with large metal buttons
Shoes: Black, Oxford, Pointed Shoes, size 7 or 8

Case reference: 2019009156.CaseDesc: Yves Guérin was last seen in January 1991, when he left his residence in Montréal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005425.CaseDesc: On March 22, 2010, at approximately 6:00 a.m., Tong-kok Lam was seen for the last time by her husband as he left their home to go to work. When Tong-kok’s husband returned, she and some of her personal belongings were gone.

Case reference: 2012020024.CaseDesc: On February 24, 1995 what appeared to be a partial skull with an attached vertebra was located near a creek; just south of Highway 7, approximately 800 metres east of the Ruskin Bridge in Mission, B.C.  A DNA profile confirmed that this person was a female, and her DNA profile has been provided to every laboratory in Canada and shared with Interpol.  In August 2002, bones recovered during a search of a farm associated to Robert Pickton were confirmed to be genetically linked to this partial skull.  It is possible that this woman's family does not know that she is missing or may be under the mistaken belief that she was reported missing and there is a file open.

Case reference: 2014005193.CaseDesc: Margaret Schwabe was last seen at her home in East St. Paul, Manitoba. She has not been seen since.

Hair: Grey, Wavy, Short, Hair was dyed dark brown with a red undertone
Teeth: Full upper dentures and a partial dental plate on lower jaw

Case reference: 2014005770.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1979, Thomas Lidguerre and Lawrence Sanger headed out from Fond du Lac to Uranium City on Lake Athabaska. The boat was located two days later, swamped near the Narrows and Popular Point. A search was conducted and lasted for over one month without any success in locating M. Lidguerre and M. Sanger.

Case reference: 2014005583.CaseDesc: Mary Mark was a resident of east Vancouver in the 1970's. She did not apply for any government-issued identification or obtain social assistance, so information is very sparse on Mrs. Mark's life after 1975. It is believed that she met with foul play as the result of domestic violence. Her body was never recovered and the suspect is now deceased.

Case reference: 2016008425.CaseDesc: Colleen Sylvia Smith was last seen at home, on February 9, 2016, by her ex-boyfriend/landlord.

Case reference: 2020022042.CaseDesc: On January 10, 1996, the body of a man believed to be between the ages of 30-40 was found in a hotel room in downtown Quebec City, Quebec. The man expressed himself in English and he had with him a travel bag containing several personal belongings, suggesting that he came from outside the region or country.

Hair: Brown, Curly, Short, Shaved on sides, curly on top
Watch: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Gold, Brand GUESS

Case reference: 2019059679.CaseDesc: On January 14, 2017, the skeletal remains of an older man were found in a homeless encampment along Grandview Highway in Vancouver, British Columbia. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains. Residents claimed that he had been there for several years, and went by the name Gordon. He was a small man, who had fractured his nose at some point in his past, and was known to eat a lot of Cheddar Jalapeno Cheetos.

Jeans: Blue, KIRKLAND, Yellow and blue rope tied around waist

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2014005451.CaseDesc: John W. Burton along with two passengers (Clifford Dowson and Edward Flett) were flying from Oxford House to Island Lake. Mr. Burton was the pilot of the Cessna 185. Around 11:00 am Mr. Burton made a routine call stating that the airplane would be landing in Garden Hill in approximately 15 minutes. The airplane did not arrive at its destination. The wreckage and all three on board were never located.

Case reference: 2020006266.CaseDesc: On February 25, 1959, Richard "Ricky" Culford was seen for the last time on Ward’s Island in Toronto, Ontario. He was last seen playing on the beach with a stick. When his mother went to retrieve him, Ricky was gone.

Hat: Brown, Gabardine helmet with a peak

Case reference: 2014001247.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1989, Henry and his brother, William Gerbrand, were fishing in a canoe on Codette Lake near Nipawin, SK. At approximately 8:00 p.m., boaters heard calls for help. It is suspected that both men drowned; divers were unable to find them.

Case reference: 2014004061.CaseDesc: On March 10, 1984, Robert Dwyer was seen for the last time when he left his residence at the Keirstead Trailer Park, which is located on the west side of Saint John, New Brunswick.

Jacket: Grey, Bomber, dark grey corduroy front

Case reference: 2012020163.CaseDesc: An adult male was recovered from the water at Duval Point.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Brown with grey streaks

Case reference: 2014005607.CaseDesc: Eleanor Eatha Parkinson-Jenkins was last seen on Monday March 1, 1982. At that time, she was living in Saint-Bruno-de Montarville. She was reported missing by her family. Ms. Parkinson-Jenkins had been ill for the past six months. She would normally leave a note when she left, but not that morning. She usually spent her days in bed or never went out alone. She would have left after the departure of her husband and did not take her purse with her. She left on foot and never came back. She is a originally from Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003711.CaseDesc: Between May 25 and June 2, 1978, Gerry Maurice Gascon received the services of the Algoma Hospital in the City of Greater Sudbury. He has not been in contact with anyone since his release from Algoma Hospital.  Gerry usually wears blue jeans, a black leather jacket and cowboy boots.

Case reference: 2018063020.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1997, Donghui Zhao was last heard from when he spoke with his friend in Toronto, Ontario. Donghui had not been seen or heard from for three months before his disappearance was reported.

Case reference: 2007002999.CaseDesc: Luciano Trinaistich was last seen at his residence on the 24th of July 2007 where he left and indicated that he was going to pick blueberries along Murphy Road near Timmins, Ontario. When he did not return home his wife contacted the Timmins Police Service and reported him missing. A search was conducted by the Timmins Police Service and the Ontario Provincial Police which resulted in locating the missing male's vehicle parked down a sideroad that runs off of Murphy Road. An extensive ground search has been conducted in the vicinity of the recovered vehicle with negative results.

Case reference: 2014006225.CaseDesc: On August 28, 2001, Erum KAMAL was seen for the last time near the High Level bridge in Edmonton, Alberta.  Erum was wearing a white t-shirt, blue pants and was described as a Southeast Asian from Pakistan.

Case reference: 2006022899.CaseDesc: Eric  Schoenleber was last seen while fishing in a canoe on Innes Lake on May 16, 1972.

Case reference: 2014001967.CaseDesc: Mary Agnes Thomas was last seen on September 10, 1971 in a bush camp on the Fraser River approximately 2.4 kilometers from Quesnel, BC. Mrs. Thomas was with friends and is described as having been heavily intoxicated at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014029389.CaseDesc: Jed Ouillette was last seen on the afternoon of September 8, 2014. Personal identification items were left behind at his residence. Mr. Ouillette had lost his driver's license due to medical issues involving seizures and was in financial difficulty.

Case reference: 2018063460.CaseDesc: On October 13, 1992, at approximately 8:30 am, Debra Kumar was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014033444.CaseDesc: On the evening of May 2, 1979, Michel Pelletier, and his older sister, were seen for the last time playing in their relatives’ backyard in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. On July 13, 1979, the body of Michel’s sister was found in the St-Lawrence River, however he has not been found.

Case reference: 2014001218.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1974, the body of an adult female was found approximately 19 miles Northeast of Penticton near Chute Lake Road, Naramata. The body was located down an embankment beside an isolated narrow dirt road in a heavily wooded area. It is estimated that the body had been at this location for a couple of months. It was noted that the female’s teeth were in good condition and she had high quality fillings that were done within two or three years prior to death. Minor orthodontist work was done when the female was a young girl.

Teeth: Good, High quality fillings; good hygiene

Case reference: 2014005473.CaseDesc: Shayne Murray Robinson was last seen in Celista, British Columbia on July 23, 2010. On July 24, 2010 the vehicle that he drove was found abandoned near Barriere on Hwy 5, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2005006499.CaseDesc:
On December 17, 1977, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of Lake Ontario near Long Branch Park, Toronto. Anthropological analysis suggests that he may be Hispanic. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
It is believed that he had been dead for at least one year prior to his discovery.

Teeth: Stained, Several dental fillings and a number of teeth were lost/extracted prior to death. Staining suggest he may have been a smoker.
Jewelry: Brown, Wide brown band on his left wrist, possibly a watch.

Case reference: 2012020001.CaseDesc: Todd Beeching has been missing since mid 2005 although it wasn't reported until May 27, 2011.  He is believed to have been last seen in the Midway, BC area.

Case reference: 2014003314.CaseDesc: Dorothy Spence was last seen panhandling near a bridge in downtown Vancouver by a family member on or about August 17, 1995. Ms. Spence was of no fixed address and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. Foul play has not been ruled out in Ms. Spence's disappearance.

Case reference: 2018026641.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1991, the body of an adult Asian male was found in the Burrard Inlet, British Columbia. He was slim and healthy, with no tattoos and his teeth were in good condition. It is believed he was deceased for only one or two days prior to his body being recovered.

Case reference: 2019071976.CaseDesc: In September of 2012, Donald Watson was last seen by his mother, and his family has had no contact with him since this time. Donald is transient in nature and usually travels on foot as transportation. Canada Border Services Agency’s last documentation of Donald was in 2013 when he entered Laredo, Texas in the United States from Mexico as a pedestrian.

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2014003025.CaseDesc: On March 5, 1989, Barbara McLaughlin was last seen leaving a friends residence in Roseville, Michigan in the USA.  A few days later Barbara's car was discovered on the Bluewater Bridge in Sarnia, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004156.CaseDesc: On July 17,1975, Helen Jordan was last seen on a bench outside of 84 South Cumberland Street in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Prior to the time of her disappearance, Helen was known to frequent that area.

Case reference: 2014004896.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2002, Aiqiu Chen was seen for the last time as she was leaving her brother’s home in Toronto, Ontario. Aiqiu left with all of her belongings.

Case reference: 2014001084.CaseDesc: On August 12, 1987, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Franz Run on Whistler Mountain in British Columbia. He may have been from South Africa or the United States. It is estimated that he may have gone missing a year to three years prior and may have been despondent at the time.

Shoes: Leather, White, Nike, Tennis shoes; size 8

Case reference: 2014003815.CaseDesc: Monica Cardinal was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in February, 1997. Monica was last seen leaving a downtown hotel with an unknown male in June, 1993.

Case reference: 2012020067.CaseDesc: At the time of her disappearance she was a ward of Brandon Mental health Centre and it is believed that she walked out of the facility on her own the day of her disappearance.  She may have had a tattoo on her forearm.

Jacket: Cream, Ivory, With green and brown

Case reference: 2013000019.CaseDesc: On December 18, 2001, Terry Sagal was last seen leaving his South Regina house at approximately 11:00 am. Prior to leaving he took $50.00 cash and mentioned to his wife that he was going to get gas, pick up scotch and go to the Superstore. Shortly after leaving, Terry's Petro-Points card was used at the Albert South Petro Canada on a $26.00 purchase.

Case reference: 2014006470.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2001, Shahzad Ahmed was seen for the last time at his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Shahzad last contacted his mother by telephone to tell her that he had been fired from his job. During the course of their conversation, his mother had told him to return home to her apartment in Toronto, but he never arrived. The next telephone call that Shahzad’s mother received was from the Islamabad police in Pakistan, who had informed her that Shahzad’s luggage had been found unclaimed on the airport luggage carousel.

Case reference: 2021054828.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2021, at approximately 6:30 p.m., Berhanei Peynado was seen for the last time in the area of Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Berhanei was despondent.

Shoes: Black, White, RUNNING, Brand: Air Jordan
Coat: Black, WINTER, Winter coat with fur collar
Hat: Black, Gold, BASEBALL, Baseball hat with gold maple leaf
Tattoo: Chest, Wolf, arc angel with sword

Case reference: 2014001474.CaseDesc: Pamela was last seen at her apartment complex on Lloyd Street in the city of Greater Sudbury, Ontario, in December of 1978.  She had left her son with her neighbour, and never returned. Her family had been expecting her to visit over the Christmas holidays, but she never went. When the family began trying to find her, they found that she had been missing for some time. She had left all her identification and personal belongings behind.

Case reference: 2021052226.CaseDesc: On January 28, 2016, at approximately 1:45 p.m., Daniel Leslie was last seen at Terrapin Point, on the American side of Niagara Falls, in Niagara Falls State Park, New York. During the time of his disappearance, Daniel was despondent.

Case reference: 2014003208.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1996, Louie Stalthanee was last seen at approximately 4:00 p.m. on the East side of Fir Island on Black Lake in Saskatchewan. The boat he had been using was found beached on Fir Island. It is suspected that Mr. Stalthanee drowned; however he has never been located.

Case reference: 2012020147.CaseDesc: On March 25, 1996, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Upper Levels Highway in West Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had recovered from severe injuries to his right arm and leg. He also had a fractured skull, nose and ribs. These injuries were likely a result of a single major accident. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Corduroy, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 3/4 length coat with fleece
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Side Of Head, Recent fracture to the left temporal bone above the left ear
Nose, Old nasal fracture with visible deformity
Deformity: Shoulders, Old injury; no indication of which shoulder

Case reference: 2014004464.CaseDesc: Singh Sukmwinder Lebahna was last seen in Montreal on February 26, 2004. He left the apartment he was sharing with a friend, taking all his personal belongings, stating he wanted to live in Vancouver. Singh is originally from India.

Case reference: 2022014122.CaseDesc: On the night of April 5, 2022, Remesie Uy was seen for the last time at her home in Calgary, Alberta.  She is thought to have traveled to the Edmonton, Alberta area. Remesie has not been seen or heard from since.

Pierce: Ears, 2-3 Earrings in one ear.  Unknown which ear.

Case reference: 2006023099.CaseDesc: Gordon Zeigler was last seen on January 3, 1991, heading to a camp on Elizabeth Lake, Ontario by snowmobile. Although his snowmobile was located on Lake Nipigon, he was never found and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2017013576.CaseDesc: On December 6, 2016, Hellen Ermias and her daughter, Lina Tedros, were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. All of their personal belongings were left behind in their apartment.

Case reference: 2014006304.CaseDesc: Richard Gaida left his hometown of Martensville, Saskatchewan for Kelowna, British Columbia at the end of September, 2012.  Richard was in the Kelowna area to work, however, Richard has not been seen or heard from since September, 2012 when he was last in contact with family and co-workers.

Case reference: 2013000144.CaseDesc: Robert Angelo Furgiuele from Sault Ste-Marie, Ontario was last seen in Squamish, British-Columbia in 1991. He was residing in Squamish with his girlfriend and his daughter. He was working in a grocery store at the time. He last spoke to his mother by telephone in 1991. He might have moved to Vancouver Island, British-Columbia in 1992.

Case reference: 2014005328.CaseDesc: In October 1986, Frances Neilson was observed by family leaving her residence in Edmonton, Alberta in the family vehicle. A few days later the vehicle was recovered but Frances has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005323.CaseDesc: Darrell Hoshowski was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta, in July 1983. Prior to his disappearance, Darrell had made a withdrawal from his bank account. There is reason to believe that he may have travelled, and Vancouver, British Columbia and California were mentioned as being possible destinations.

Case reference: 2014002895.CaseDesc: Pierre Merasty grew up in the Lynn Lake area of MB and resided there until November of 1994 when he moved to Winnipeg, MB.  He lived with family and friends for a while prior to moving into a house in the downtown area of Winnipeg.  After he moved, he was never heard from again.  Mr. Merasty was known to frequent the Main Street bars and would usually walk anywhere he had to go.

Case reference: 2006000399.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1988, the body of a Caucasian male was recovered from the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 132lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Auburn, Bald, Wavy, Balding in front, sideburns and unshaven with several days growth
Teeth: Many amalgam fillings, 1 composite resin restoration. Missing multiple upper and lower posterior teeth prior to death.
Jeans: Blue, "Renée de France" Brand, size 34" waist and 34" inseam
Money: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Canadian coins $2.26, one American dime
Belt: Leather, Brown, Size 34, with gold buckle & "Genuine Olde English Leather" written on the inner portion
Fractured/Broken Bones: Healed fracture, noticeable bump on the middle of his right collarbone.

Case reference: 2006027999.CaseDesc: On August 15, 1986 Clayton Duncan McFaul was last seen by a family member on the family farm near Havelock Ontario. Mr. McFaul was completing his usual daily farm chores. He was very punctual about meal times, so when he failed to arrive for his lunch his family were concerned. An extensive search failed to locate Mr. McFaul.  Several possible sightings were reported after August 15, 1986, but none led to Mr. McFaul's location.

Hair: Bald, White, Other, Bald with fringe

Case reference: 2014001392.CaseDesc: On March 31, 1994, Kuldip Singh was seen for the last time in Brampton, Ontario.  There is a possibility that Mr. Singh may be in the United States.

Case reference: 2019075256.CaseDesc: On December 29, 2020 between 4:00 and 5:00 am, Joel Judd was last seen leaving a party at a residence in Slave Lake, Alberta.

Case reference: 2016068410.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1966, the body of a Caucasian male was recovered from the Grand River in Onondaga Township, Brant County. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 170lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. This individual consumed a large meal of corn shortly before his death. He was uncircumcised. It is estimated that he died in the latter half of August or early in September 1966.

Teeth: Many of his teeth were missing and some of the remaining teeth showed evidence of dental work.
Scar: Right Abdomen, Old, well healed 2" appendectomy scar running obliquely

Case reference: 2006010699.CaseDesc: Greg Gan departed from the family home, on foot, on October 19, 1978. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2009005499.CaseDesc: Joanne Foley was last seen in May of 1989, when she was staying with friends in Port McNicoll, Ontario.  She had mentioned that she was planning on going to western Canada, but there is no indication that she travelled there.  She has had no contact with friends or relatives since May 1989.

Case reference: 2013000089.CaseDesc: Daniel Marceau was last seen on June 7, 1989 in Montréal. He was despondent, and told a friend that he was going up north to reflect on his life.

Case reference: 2013000093.CaseDesc: On July 10, 1989, Arlene Gagne was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Arlene told her husband that she wanted to stay home for the day. When her husband came back, Arlene was not home. All of her personal belongings were left at home.

Case reference: 2021050310.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of October 13, 2021, Cody Harper was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Cody has not been seen or heard from since this time.

Case reference: 2013000041.CaseDesc: David Luborksy was reported missing on the 4th of November 2010. Mr. Luborksy was last seen leaving the Parklane Residence which is situated at 1095 Merivale Road, in the City of Ottawa.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Irishman holding a beer
Right Side Of Neck, Clover leaf

Case reference: 2014002239.CaseDesc: On the August 24, 1993, Cynthia-Ann Peddle, commonly known as Cindy Paddle, was seen for the last time in Sept-Îles, Quebec. There is a possibility that Cindy frequented the area of Vieux Quai in Sept-Îles before her disappearance.

Vest: Red, Pink, T-Shirt, Pink or red
Pants: Denim, Blue, Faded Jeans, thigh pockets

Case reference: 2020008361.CaseDesc: On May 12, 1991, at approximately 4:00pm, Ian Dickson was last seen leaving a restaurant near Yonge Street and Eglington Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Ian was visiting from Scotland, and was due to return on May 23, but he did not board his flight.

Case reference: 2015036270.CaseDesc: Brian Franko was last seen on July 10, 2015, walking away from the Saskatchewan Hospital.  He did not appear to be in a good frame of mind.  Brian was walking toward the South Saskatchewan River when he was last seen.  Extensive searches were conducted, with no success.

Case reference: 2005002199.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1980, a Caucasian male was found at a campsite (Lot 19, Con 8, Peck Township) on Hardwood Lookout Trail in Algonquin Park. The death is estimated to have occurred between July 1, 1971 and Spring 1978.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Possibly in a ponytail
Wallet: Black, with 8 cent stamp issues between July 1, 1971 and September 1, 1976
Other: A folding camp stove; and an aluminum camper's pot with a lid
A black down-filled sleeping bag with a nylon outer shell
Belt: 36 inch, wear shown at 32 inch hole

Case reference: 2014001116.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1992, the skeletal remains of a man were found near Parksville on the Englishman River in British Colombia. The man had extensive dental restorations and may have been American. He recently had surgery for ingrown toenails, on both feet, and had a healed fracture to the left collarbone, which was repaired with a surgical wire. It is estimated that he may have died several months earlier.

Shirt: Other, T-Shirt, Brand Royal Comfort, size 42-44
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Wristwatch, Casio
Shoes: White, Grey, Runners, Brand Brooks, blue striped
Fractured/Broken Bones: Chest, Healed rib and clavicle fracture
Foreign Object: Chest, Stainless steel wire in the left clavicle

Case reference: 1999003370.CaseDesc: Nancy Liou was last seen at home on January 27, 1999. On January 28, her father contacted Nancy's school to see if she was there, and was advised they had no way of knowing if she was in attendance as it was exam time. Her father contacted police that evening when she failed to return home from school.  She had advised a family member she was leaving but never said where she was headed.

Case reference: 2012020121.CaseDesc: Mathieu Beauregard Messier was alone at home with his wife. At approximately 7:00 p.m., Mathieu told his wife he had to go see a friend and that he would be back later in the evening. He left alone in his wife’s vehicle and with her cellphone. At approximately 10:30 p.m., police received a call that a vehicle was on fire on Rang du Haut-de-la-Rivière, near the military base in Farnham, Quebec. The vehicle was identified as that of Mathieu’s wife. There was nobody inside the vehicle, and Mathieu has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004476.CaseDesc: Gayebrella King was reported missing by her family on May 8, 1980. She was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta in late August 1978.

Case reference: 2013000102.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1981 at approximately 7:30 p.m., Lawrence (Larry) Bennett left Princess Harbour, Manitoba in his boat heading for Matheson Island. He left with his sheepdog, and the trip should have taken 20-25 minutes. When he left he was traveling straight into the wind, and the water was reported as being rough. Mr. Bennett never arrived at Matheson Island. Mr. Bennett is presumed to have drowned, his remains have never been recovered.

Case reference: 2018054180.CaseDesc: On May 8, 1992, John Leonard was seen for the last time when he borrowed a friend's vehicle.  Later that same day, the vehicle was recovered at Woodbine Racetrack in Toronto.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Pair of dice

Case reference: 2010003499.CaseDesc:
On March 21, 2010 Chung Law left work on Dundas St, London ON. He told his employer that he was experiencing some stress and would be taking a couple of days off. Mr. Law spoke to his wife, who lives in Vaughan, ON, and told her he was coming home for a visit. He spoke to his employer the next day, saying he was in Toronto and that he did not want to return to work in London. Mr. Law never did arrive home. Investigation has revealed that Mr. Law may have travelled to Toronto by bus. 

In April, 2011 a right foot contained within a black boot was located in the river flats of the Thames River in Elgin County. The area was searched and no further remains were found. DNA confirmed that the foot was that of Mr. Law.

Scar: Left Thigh, Surgery scar on upper left thigh

Case reference: 2019010720.CaseDesc: Patrick Comeau was last seen on November 13, 2017, in Montreal, Quebec. Patrick has been known to frequent the downtown Montreal area.

Case reference: 2014003163.CaseDesc: John Timothy McCarthy was last seen in Red Deer, Alberta on May 1, 1991. His van was located in Sault St Marie, Ontario, however it is not known if he stayed in the Ontario region or went on to the United States.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold, Wedding ring with small diamonds

Case reference: 2014004614.CaseDesc: Jacob Miller has gone missing in the past, however he has always returned. Mr. Miller was last seen in Winnipeg, MB going for a walk carrying a green backpack and appearing quite disheveled.

Case reference: 2012020050.CaseDesc: Shirley Lonethunder originally from White Bear First Nation near Carlyle, SK went missing from downtown Saskatoon, SK on the afternoon of December 24, 1991.

Case reference: 2014005536.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of March 25, 1996, Renée Simard was seen for the last time as she left her family home in Matane, Quebec. Renée had indicated that she was going for a walk, and at approximately 2:30 p.m. she was seen near the wharf along the Matane River at the mouth of the St. Lawrence River.

Case reference: 2016068443.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1980, an arm was recovered from Lake Erie, on the beach in front of 400 Cooper Lane in Amherstburg. The remains were thought to be probably female. The time since death is probably no more than one year.

Case reference: 2019053661.CaseDesc:
On July 2, 1988, an unidentified man was found in the parking lot of the Value Village
on East Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had suffered from a
heart attack, and the results of his autopsy showed evidence of previous heart damage and a case of mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

Case reference: 2019009625.CaseDesc: On August 12, 2018, Nikhil Arun was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017074170.CaseDesc: On October 8, 2015, an unidentified man was found in Lake Ontario in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004721.CaseDesc: Belinda Gertrude Williams was last seen by her sister and father in July 1976 in Vancouver. Ms. Williams was not reported missing until February 2004 to the Stl'Atl'lmx Tribal Police in Mt. Currie, BC.  Stl'Atl'lmx Tribal Police determined that Ms. Williams was last seen in Mission, BC.

Scar: Eyes, Below eye, unknown which eye

Case reference: 2016061088.CaseDesc:
On April 25, 1982, the remains of a Black female were found in the Detroit River, near Maple Leaf Mills processing plant, in the city of Windsor, Ontario. Her appendix was present.
She is estimated to have been in the water for 2-4 weeks.

Pants: Beige, Red, Checkered pants with an elastic waist band
Jacket: Light Blue, White, Waist length button down jacket with white edging. Burn mark on the right sleeve.
Tattoo: Right Thigh, Mid-thigh, described as a "Bulls Eye", with the word "Lots" or "Lets"
Scar: Left Chest, 42 cm Thoracotomy scar with metal surgical sutures

Case reference: 2014005291.CaseDesc: On September 4, 1990, at approximately 6:50am, Ann Lylyck was last seen by her friend when he dropped her and her dog off at the Our Lady of Mercy Hospital in Toronto, Ontario. Ann was intending on visiting her aunt, but wanted to walk her dog before going into the hospital. When her friend returned a few hours later, Ann could not be located.
